titleStmt.title: The two feruent louers. Or A warlike kind of wooing as here at large is said betweene a braue young man, and a faithfull hearted maid. To the tune of the two louing sisters, or lulling beyond thee.
titleStmt.author: L. P. (Laurence Price), fl. 1625-1680?

notesStmt.note: Verse - "As Phebus in the lustrious aire,".
In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproductions of original in the British Library.
